contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the continuation of Yahweh's instruction to David that began in [2 Samuel 5:23](../05/23.md). Yahweh here speaks of himself in the third person. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-123person]])
contextId.glQuote: When you hear ... Yahweh will have gone out before you to attack the army of the Philistines

contextId.glQuote: Your servant will do all that my master the king commands his servant

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Hushai is referring to Absalom in the third person to take emphasize off of him and place it on Yahweh and the people who chose him. This can be written in second person. Alternate translation: "you are the one whom ... you are the man ... with you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-123person]])
contextId.glQuote: the one whom ... that is the man ... with him
